title: Why I Don’t Care About a Looming Stock Market Crash
subtitle: Discover why long-term investing trumps short-term fears.
content:
Why I Don’t Care About a Looming Stock Market Crash

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Here’s exactly why I do not care about a looming stock market crash, and I never will:

1. Historical Perspective

Since 1987, we have experienced two major market crashes, four recessions, two debt ceilings, and roughly 470 headlines claiming it's the end of capitalism. Yet...

2. Long-term Growth

A $10,000 investment in the S&P 500 has grown to over $280,000 over that time period. It goes to show the resilience and growth potential of the market.

3. Timing the Market

On the other hand, those who kept waiting for stability are still waiting. Don’t let CNBC or any financial news outlet dictate your investment strategy. Remember, they are entertainers with access to a Bloomberg terminal, not your personal financial advisors.
